Class SocialNetwork

public class SocialNetwork
This class represents a basic social network with functionalities for managing users and their friends.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

  • Method Details

    • addUser

      public static String addUser(String network, String user, String friends)
      [Basic Task] Adds a new user along with their friends to the social network.
      You do not have to worry about having two duplicate users in the network. In particular, you do not have to worry about these two possibilities:
      • Two duplicate users with the same casing. Example: ",mxw:elba,mxw:jachi,"
      • Two duplicate users with different casing. Example: ",mxw:elba,MXw:jachi,"
      Example: Adding a user to an existing network
      Let's say our network is: 
      String network = ",elba:lucy-gigi,mxw:donatello01,";
      Now, we want to add a new user "mNaTs" with friends "fluffygumball-jachi" to this network. The addUser method works like this: 
      network = addUser(network, "mNaTs", "fluffygumball-jachi");
System.out.println(network); // Output: ",elba:lucy-gigi,mxw:donatello01,mNaTs:fluffygumball-jachi,"
      Parameters:
      network - The current state of the social network where each user and their friends are separated by a colon (:), and each user-friends pair is followed by a comma (,).
      user - The user to be added to the social network where the user is guaranteed to only contain alphabets and numbers (no special characters).
      friends - The user's friend(s), formatted as "friend1-friend2-friend3...". If there are no friends, this parameter will be an empty String (""). The friends list is guaranteed to only contain alphabets and numbers (no special characters), formatted with hyphens (-) to separate individual friends.
      Returns:
      Updated network string, which includes the newly added user and their friend(s) at the end of the current network.

    • removeUser

      public static String removeUser(String network, String userToDelete)
      [Basic Task] Removes a specified user from the social network, treating the user's name in a case-insensitive manner.
      In other words, since user names are treated in a case-insensitive manner, that means 'MXW', 'mWw', 'mxw', etc., are all considered equivalent.
      You may assume that the user to be deleted always exists in the network so you do not have to handle the case that the user does not exist!
      Example usage of removeUser: 
      String network = ",elba:lucy-gigi,mxw:donatello01,mNaTs:fluffygumball-jachi,";
network = removeUser(network, "MXw"); // This will remove 'mxw' in our network regardless of its casing.
System.out.println(network); // Output: ",elba:lucy-gigi,mNaTs:fluffygumball-jachi,"
      Parameters:
      network - The current state of the social network where each user and their friends are separated by a colon (:), and each user-friends pair is followed by a comma (,).
      userToDelete - The username of the user to be removed, compared in a case-insensitive manner.
      Returns:
      This is the updated network string after the specified user has been removed.

    • networkSize

      public static int networkSize(String network)
      [Basic Task] Counts the number of user(s) in the social network. Note that each user in the network is immediately followed by the colon (:) character.
      Example usage of networkSize: 
      String network = ",elba:lucy-gigi,mxw:donatello01,mNaTs:fluffygumball-jachi,";
int userCount = networkSize(network);
System.out.println(userCount); // Output: 3
      Parameters:
      network - The current state of the social network where each user and their friends are separated by a colon (:), and each user-friends pair is followed by a comma (,).
      Returns:
      The total number of users in the network.

    • indexOfComma

      public static int indexOfComma(String network, int nthOccurrence)
      [Required to use for All Creative Extension] Finds the index of a specific occurrence of a comma in the social network string. We will use this method later in whichever extension option we choose to help with identifying the positions of different users and their friends since we know that each user-friends pair is followed by a comma (,).
      Example usage of indexOfComma: 
      String network = ",elba:lucy-gigi,mxw:donatello01,mNaTs:fluffygumball-jachi,";
int indexOfFirstComma = indexOfComma(network, 0);
int indexOfSecondComma = indexOfComma(network, 1);
System.out.println(indexOfFirstComma); // Output: 0
System.out.println(indexOfSecondComma); // Output: 15
      Parameters:
      network - The current state of the social network where each user and their friends are separated by a colon (:), and each user-friends pair is followed by a comma (,).
      nthOccurrence - The specific occurrence of the comma to find. The first occurrence is denoted by 0, the second by 1, and so on.
      Returns:
      The index where the nth occurrence of a comma is found, or -1 if it does not exist.

    • randomUser

      public static String randomUser(Random randy, String network)
      [Creative Extension Option 1] Selects and returns a random user and their friends from the network. If the network is empty, then return "No users".
      Example: Selecting a random user from a populated network 
      String network = ",elba:lucy-gigi,mxw:donatello01,mNaTs:fluffygumball-jachi,";
Random randy = new Random();
String randomUser = randomUser(randy, network);
System.out.println(randomUser); // Output might be "elba: lucy-gigi". Note: The output format is "username: friend1-friend2", with a space after the colon.
      Parameters:
      randy - A Random object used to generate a random index.
      network - The current state of the social network where each user and their friends are separated by a colon (:), and each user-friends pair is followed by a comma (,).
      Returns:
      A string representing a random user and their friends in the format user: friend1-friend2-friend3...

    • listUserInfo

      public static void listUserInfo(String network)
      [Creative Extension Option 2] Print a list of all users and their friends in the network. If the network is empty, no output will be printed.
      Example usage of listUserInfo 
      String network = ",elba:lucy-gigi,mxw:,mNaTs:fluffygumball-jachi,";
listUserInfo(network);
      This method call would print each user and their friends in the network in the format: 
      elba: lucy-gigi
mxw:
mNaTs: fluffygumball-jachi
      Note: The output format is "username: friend1-friend2", with a space after the colon. For 'mxw', there is still a space after the colon even though there is no friend list after the colon.
      Parameters:
      network - The current state of the social network where each user and their friends are separated by a colon (:), and each user-friends pair is followed by a comma (,).

    • countFriends

      public static int countFriends(String network, String userName)
      [Creative Extension Option 3] Counts the number of friends of a specific user in the network, treating the user name in a case-insensitive manner. It assumes that the given name is always valid and present in the network, treating names like 'mxw', 'mXw', 'MXW', etc., as equivalent.
      Example usage of countFriends 
      String network = ",elba:lucy-gigi,mxw:donatello01,mNaTs:fluffygumball-jachi,";
int friendCount = countFriends(network, "MNATS"); // This will count friends of 'mNaTs' regardless of its casing.
System.out.println(friendCount); // Output: 2
      Parameters:
      network - The current state of the social network where each user and their friends are separated by a colon (:), and each user-friends pair is followed by a comma (,).
      userName - The name of the user whose friends are to be counted. This username is case-insensitive and guaranteed to be valid and present in the network.
      Returns:
      The number of friends of the specified user.
